im trying to play through every mainline half life game in preparation for alyx

the original half life is kinda in a weird spot for me, i really wanted to like it, but its just too old, even with godmode on and noclipping every now and then the game just felt like a slog, but on the other hand, im really glad i played it

i havent played black mesa, but ive heard good things about it, if youre looking to play the original half life for the first time, or just looking to play through them all for alyx like i am, i recommend trying black mesa instead

[h1][b] Review For The Game Half-Life [/b][/h1]

The game's best quote: "[i]You think there's a cold beer for us at the end of all this?[/i]"

This was more than I expected.

I've heard people say that this game is one of the greatest games of all time. I don't blame them, it's definitely one of the greatest ones I've ever played. Everything about Half-Life is unique and fun. The story, the characters and the combat system stands out the most. One thing about Half-Life I find especially fun, is the expolration of Black Mesa. Almost every new part of the research facilty is unique, which is a thing that keeps you open-minded and optimistic about the things that you're going to see next. Another thing that I absolutely love about this game, is the fact that I didn't care about the graphics at all. It's obvious that the game's engine hasn't aged well, but everything else about the game is fresh and has aged really well. I really couldn't experience and/or see any other flaws in Half-Life, and I think it's a true sign of its perfection.

+ Great story.
+ Great characters.
+ Great combat system.
+ Great A.I.
+ Great expierience all around.

This is a great classic first person shooter. Graphics are amazing even for the year it came out. You're not bombarded with long video clips like nowadays, which many games are half movies. Some games even got the credits in there. It's a good balance of shooting, jumping, navigating, as well as puzzle solving. Meaning, it's not too much of any, where some games may overdo some of those aspects. The puzzles aren't so hard that you'll lose patience. The enemies aren't so hard that you'll give up. It's just a very humble first person shooter that keeps you entertained.

Despite me only having played this game for a combined total of 7 hours , I would recommend this very much. Very great classic , showcasing Valve's impressive ability to create games , even when they were in their bare beginnings. The gameplay is entertaining and on the edge of your seat-worthy , along with an interesting and in-depth story. The graphics , while decent , are somewhat impressive , especially for it's time. I would recommend this game to anyone seeking a great classic. I would give it a neat 8/10 , with it's impressive graphics and epic gameplay , of course , nothing's perfect , so their is flaws and bugs , but they are few and far in between.

this game. This game is so much fun. But for todays standards? Absolutely horrible. Now before you witch hunt me, listen to what i have to say. As someone who hasnt played games older than tf2, this game is bad. At the time this game mightve been awesome, but now, its just not good. Super unpolished, miss 1 line of dialogue and forced to redo an entire chapter, and oh my god how TEDIOUS this game can be. On the chapter before forget freeman! theres enemys that hide in sniper spots, and i could not kill one! plus i only had 4 health and there were no medpacks around. Then , lemme just tell you of how much of a trainwreck forget freeman is. Enemies that appear out of nowhere, enemies that take 4 shotgun blasts to kill AND have tracking weapons. All in a tight room. Plus, theres little bugs that run around and deal 10 damage and are impossible to hit because of how small they are. I never got past forget about freeman. And i just cant beat it. And its not that im a bad gamer, ive been playing games for about 7 years now and i CANT get past this part. First 6-8 hours are amazing. then it becomes tedious and annoying. Although, i do recommend it, but i personally dont like it.
